WorkItem.ClosedComment: TypeScript uses the same syntax rules for semicolon insertion as JavaScript. See also https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/897
WorkItem.Summary: return value with newline becomes undefined.

Comments.Message:
Given the intent to keep TypeScript tightly aligned with JavaScript I would have thought this was intentional and desirable.

http://encosia.com/in-javascript-curly-brace-placement-matters-an-example/
